name: GetPayrollPeriodDataByPayrollPeriodDataId
description:
__Activity name :__ GetPayrollPeriodDataByPayrollPeriodDataId

Get the details of payroll period data

payrollperioddataId.description: The unique identifier of the payroll period data

Authorization.description: A valid Bearer token for authorizing the request.

Accept.description: The accept header is used to influence what type of output is returned and in most cases the version of the output

$ul: **obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
**costCenter**: The cost center on which the payroll period data for this record will be booked for the ledger.
**costUnit**: The cost unit on which the data for this record will be booked for the ledger
**distributionUnit**: Distribution unit, used in several reports and the "basic wage journal" functionality. Commonly used as a cost center.
**key**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**id**: The unique identifier of an object (GUID/UUID)
**periodEndDate**: The last day of the period to which the payroll period data applies
**periodNumber**: The period (month [1 to 12] , 4 weeks [1 to 13] or week [1 to 53]) of the payroll period in which the payroll data is to be processed.
**periodStartDate**: The first day of the period to which the payroll period data applies
**year**: The year of the payroll period in which the payroll data is to be processed
**payslipText**: A custom text to be displayed on the payslip.
**payslipType**: The type of payslip (as defined by the Dutch tax authorities)
**shift**: The shift determines the full-time hours and bonus percentage.
**bonusPercentage**: The bonus percentage used in wage calculations for the hours made in this shift.
**fullTimeHoursPerWeek**: The full time hours for an employment that is linked to this shift.
**shiftNumber**: The number for the shift. Loket.nl supports a maximum of 5 shifts per payroll administration.
**obsoleteDate**: The date (can be null) on which the `resourceVersion` is no longer supported/available
**resourceVersion**: The resource version of the object in the response
